main event: Two Air Force pilots observed three unidentified flying objects during a training flight over Chitose Air Base in Hokkaido, Japan on November 15, 1957.
interesting points: The pilots noted the objects were round and estimated their size to be 30 to 50 feet in diameter,The UFOs had a metallic or aluminum-like appearance,The objects changed direction and speed rapidly, with speeds estimated at 600 to 700 mph,The sighting lasted approximately 10 minutes,The report includes six high-quality black and white photographs of the UFOs.
witness description: Air Force pilots 1st Lieutenant Kenjiro Yoshida and 2nd Lieutenant Isao Akita
